thread.title: Jose Mourinho could be without SEVEN stars for Manchester United's clash with West Brom
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho could be without SEVEN stars for Manchester United's clash with West Brom

author: David McDonnell
title: Jose Mourinho could be without SEVEN stars for Manchester United's clash with West Brom
text:
Sport Jose Mourinho could be without SEVEN stars for Manchester United's clash with West Brom United are without injured quartet Phil Jones, Chris Smalling, Marouane Fellaini and Paul Pogba, while Ander Herrera and Zlatan Ibrahimovic are suspended Share Jose Mourinho has a selection headache (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho is facing a personnel crisis ahead of Manchester United ’s Premier League clash with West Brom this weekend. 
Mourinho fears he will be without up to seven players for the Old Trafford clash United must win to keep alive their hopes of securing a top-four finish. 
United are currently without injured quartet Phil Jones, Chris Smalling, Marouane Fellaini and Paul Pogba, while Ander Herrera and Zlatan Ibrahimovic are suspended. 
Skipper Wayne Rooney has been out with a knee injury for the past three weeks and there is no guarantee he will be fit by Saturday, although sources have indicated the 31-year old is ready to return. Chris Smalling and Phil Jones are both crocked (Photo: Getty) 
But Mourinho may be forced to rush Rooney back to plug a gap in midfield, with the enforced loss of Pogba, Fellaini and Herrera leaving him light there. 
Michael Carrick remains Mourinho’s only fit central midfielder, a position Rooney may have to occupy on Saturday if he is fit and able to start. 
Rooney last featured in midfield last season under former boss Louis van Gaal, although versatile defender Daley Blind is also able to operate there if required. 
United face a hectic April with games against West Brom, Everton, Sunderland, Anderlecht, Chelsea, Burnley, Manchester City and Swansea. Wayne Rooney faces a race against time to be fit (Photo: REUTERS) 
Mourinho’s side are currently fifth, four points behind fourth-placed Liverpool, with two games in hand on their arch rivals. 
But with a run-in that includes trips to City, Arsenal and Tottenham, United’s best bet of securing Champions League football may ultimately be by winning the Europa League. 
Midfielder Juan Mata admitted United the upcoming month will be a decisive one for Mourinho and his players, with nine games to play. 
Mata said: “It’s not a random list of teams, it’s the list of the eight teams we’re going to face in a frantic month of April. Read More Patrice Evra takes his Instagram weirdness to a new level as he KISSES a monkey Juan Mata knows the stakes are high (Photo: Stu Forster / Getty) 
“Since we have to play twice against Anderlecht [first and second leg], it makes a total of nine games for us the next month. 
“It’s not a complaint, it’s just a reality and we have to adapt ourselves to it, in order to give the best we have in the decisive spell of the season. 
“I see these games as a challenge to show all the good things we’ve been working on throughout the season, and I hope that we can get good results too.” Read More Jesse Lingard prepares for fresh contract talks as he enjoys late breakfast on day off The Spaniard enjoyed a trip to Berlin during the international break (Photo: Juan Mata / Instagram) 
Mata was not included in the latest Spain squad and spent the international break travelling to Berlin as well as back to his homeland. 
“I spent the Saturday in Asturias with my family and I also attended Real Oviedo’s game at the Carlos Tartiere,” said Mata. 
“It was a nice evening in the stadium and not only because the local team won, but also because I met many friends and acquaintances I hadn’t seen in a while. 
“People were very nice with me at home and that’s something that always helps to recharge your batteries.” poll loading Will Manchester United finish in the Premier League top four? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
